intro: Derris negrensis, commonly known as the Philippine spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with simple, alternate leaves. Its small, greenish flowers are clustered in umbels, and it produces capsules as its fruit. Derris negrensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
